column5: i'm thinking about dropping my canoe in near inglewood and taking a leisurely paddle down, targeting trout. can this be done? how's the current and obstacles? anybody had success with a trip like this?
wrong time of year for trout..,bows anyway...im sure some locals will chime in with good info   Good Luck
i was hoping for browns (i hear there are some around), and maybe the odd resident bow or brookie. water looks low though, don't know that it's navigable...
guess i'll give it a shot and report back!

It's been awhile, but one of the dams around Norval is totally on private property, you have to take out above it, portage out to the road, carry all your gear around this one jerkoffs property, and put in below the dam.  Oh and watch out going through the golf courses, they tend to treat anybody in a canoe as a target.

i'll remember that about the golf courses. right there at old baseline there's the caledon club, i thought it would be a funny thing to float through it on a canoe. i don't think i'd get as far as norval anyway... likely only float down to terra cotta or so--i'll still have to paddle upstream!
